0GVYEBB2CBJqpMTLwzMqtQ.text: JUST THE BEST SUSHI IN THE CITY, try the dishes with noodles they are great!!

Ax9c1tEmNFoLS0RGbFkbqw.text: I visit London often and find Wagamama to be one of the most relaiable and reasonable meals in thervice UK. Service is quick and always find something I like on their menu. I am not a big fan of curry, however I tried the chicaken katsu curry based on a recommendation  of a friend. I did like it because it is Asian curry and a very mild curry. The new pork rib appetizer is good, pork gyoza, and I like many of their noodle dishes. They even deliver to many areas of London. On one freezing night I was happy to order and get delivery. I like this new location at the Tower of London as most of the places around there are somewhat touristy. Free Green tea with your meal as well.

0utrzRgY2Ng9gKjRV95NoA.text: Dear God,Please, please, please, please, please build one of these near me in Florida.  Boston's not close enough.  If you don't build one here, I'm going to have to move to London, which will make all the Brits sad.  Mainly because I'm sure they don't want me...Thank You,Joel

3lD_FN12Xm7tL3GJfdE2wQ.text: Great value chain - I have been to various locations a handful of times and never had a bad meal. This branch was very busy on a Monday lunchtime - but it is peak tourist season and Tower Hill was buzzing. I had a prawn/rice dish - I forget the name, but it was number 79! Plenty of king prawns, tonnes of chili, nice sticky rice (not too tricky to pick up with chopsticks) and veg. Washed down with two large glasses of ginger beer. Icing on the cake, so to speak, was the white chocolate cheesecake with toffee chili sauce. Awesome.

AHV97rEYUsDLEGq6dtQ77g.text: I just love Wagamama restaurants and have been in them all across England. this one doesnt let me down either with its friendly staff and good food just be careful as some of the dishes can be an acquired taste! but you cant go wrong with the chicken katsu curry its top notch

vmrxMG9LQ9pRiUu94orQXA.text: I often go to Wagama in the West End - a few different branches and always loved their food and found the service to be excellent.The service my friend and I received here was extermely poor. The waiter seemed to be in such a rush and was telling us to hurry up and order, when the place was almost empty and we had arrived less than a minute before. There were two other people and us. They have lost my business. The food was good but forget any service.This was the Wagama in Spitalfields.  One star for the food because the service was so bad and that spoils the enjoyment of the food. Other branches would easily get 5 stars from me.OK an update: I went again today and the service was much better so I will give them extra stars now.

AoMTlG3MREQbQBZPrkuIPQ.text: If you've ever been to a Wagamama, any Wagamama, you know about what to expect from the food. It's tasty and inexpensive and the portions are huge, green tea is free, miso is warm, and so on. But what's exceptional about this particular location are the view (tourists and locals alike can enjoy looking out over the Tower and surrounding courtyard) and the incredibly friendly service. I don't think I had a more polite server during my entire trip to visit friends in London. The staff was attentive without making me feel watched or uncomfortable, food was brought out in a timely fashion but without coming too quickly for us to enjoy conversation, and even though we arrived a mere hour before close, we never felt rushed. I'm not usually the sort to really enjoy major chain restaurants but Wagamama appears to be one very quality exception to the rule.

3Rwgag3bDM9Orc1A-Gl50w.text: I'm one of those people who only ever orders chilli chicken ramen. a big bowl of chicken, noodles and fresh vegetables plus as much green tea as I want. At £8.25 for the meal, how can they possibly make any money out of me? Probably because I'm usually dragging along friends or relatives who are far too embarrassed to be a cheapskate :-) This one at Tower Hill is a favourite, close to the river and the Tower.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom

in0w89QYux5hJAuRbQVOVA.text: I only really go to Wagamama when there's one of those two for one promotions - a bowl of chicken ramen each for a friend and me for around £4 is really a bargain! Make sure to order the green tea - it's free, and is rather tasty! You should note that you'll probably be eating with other people - it's canteen style.

Z3VDvsUQgsH5FBhrdl9MhQ.text: I think this is what asian food taste like if they're trying to cater to western palate.  Or maybe how it taste when you don't have anybody who's asian cooking the food.  We had 7 people in our group, so I got to taste at least 7 orders and some side orders, and did not like any of them. The only reason I give 2 stars instead of 1 is because the food is relatively inexpensive.

9_5ficcjxj6kY0OnKVG8ZA.text: We eat here usually once or twice a week, and the chicken katsu curry is the best. Make sure you try out the soups as well if you are really hungry as they are the most filling dishes. and checkout the website as they do 2for1 offers if u sign up. we make great use of these. the food standard is great, and as i said, we go back a lot of times. The staff even reconise us now. Mon - wed is quieter, 12-1pm but can get really busy thurs/friday. and there are queues out the door after 1pm so get there early as i said, we love it and im sure you will to

FT8Rgn8vKLOnqlb08ujlsg.text: Wagamamas are a Japanese restaurant- dishes are mainly noodle based but their are some rice dishes and you always subsitute the noodles for rice. My fav is the udon noodles with chicken, chilli sauce, prawns. You also green free unlimited green tea, and their fresh fruit juices are delicious. Try the white chocolate and stem ginger cheesecake for dessert. Sign up to the Wagamama club on their website- you get access to promotions such as buy one get one free, free drink, free dessert, free side order.

n3X1LKjguMQawKKxw8e-5g.text: You always know what you're getting with wagamama..The food is kept to form in every one I've ever been too, including the one in Amsterdam. The ramen is great, I'm particularly fond of the chilli beef one but the chicken one is also good. Love the starters, edamame..gyoza..ebi katsu..yakitori. All always great! The chicken tama rice is good, as are the udon dishes. Remember to take advantage of the free green tea on offer (it's not widely advertised). Oh and add your address to their mailing list for details of special offers.

EajOwbdpwhBdnUWjsUQlvw.text: As with all the other Wagamamas, the chicken kare lomen, a curry noodle soup, is great and you should eat the white chocolate ginger cheesecake at least once before you die.

fc_KmbaqEeyXpNj39j75XA.text: Wagamama may be a chain, but it's a good one - and one I can't get back home. I love this place, and the Tower Hill location has a sensational view of the Tower of London, Tower Bridge, the Thames etc. The food has never disappointed me there, nor has the establishment itself.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom

LEYgtxJP4AWjtOxA-j7tDA.text: Had Wagamama for lunch today. Food was a let down. Itame was super bland, gyoza that tastes like rubber The flowering tea however was delicious. I probably won't eat at Wagamama again unless my company is paying.

E0vlCsdb_UOonhd0kD4h9w.text: Excellent Asian food. I have to eat here every time I go to London as there are no locations in the states. The food is healthy, not heavy, mostly noodle Asian food.The seating is cafeteria style tables so it can accommodate large groups. The orders come out as they are prepared so everyone may not get their food all at once, however that ensures that your food is always as fresh as can be.I recommend trying their amazing appetizers.If you're doing the tourist thing and checking out the Tower of London, stop into Wagamama. The view from their windows is directly across to the Tower (as well as the Tower Bridge in the background).

ncykKQkemT2lKCegF6Tm5g.text: This place is adequate. Certainly doesn't deserve 5 stars. The ingredients are fresh. The atmosphere is uninspired but with a decent view. I've had better noodles many places but I have no complaints. I just think the other reviews are inflated.

P7wjvA-AaZvBDa5CrGj6mw.text: A decent meal for ten pounds. The chicken danburi bowl was very good, but extremely salty and overdosed in sugary sauce. The flavor was a bit strong because of this. Not sure I'd go back, but it was good in a pinch.

HASQj7xFrhk7seKaSaM1lw.text: Friendly staff and a airy layout make this place one of the better Wagamama's I've ever been in. Of course it's the same menu that all the other chain venues offer, but that's no bad thing, and I'm happy to say that everything I ordered was delivered hot and as tasty as any of their restaurants I've ever been to - which actually hasn't always been the case with all their restaurants.  The food was good, the venue was better.

hUQhRAjpFh_q1WJcHqP1wg.text: Tried here on a whim after visiting the Tower of London and walking around. It was an incredibly sweltering day and this particular establishment did not have air con. Luckily they were very generous with the ice water. The food was decent, and filled my appetite for ramen which I rarely get to eat.

PXTVaBZmGcjy8hyQK29ltw.text: it was Monday night and we were in the mood for some winter warming soup. We ordered :* Chilli Ramen with Beef - Beef was inedible and tasted very metallic and bitter, bland broth* Wagamama Ramen  - under cooked prawns, burnt chicken, overcooked noodles, bland brothWe asked for the cheque and left without eating our food.  i've eaten in some good wagamama's before, but this is not one of them....They suggested we could have told them we were unhappy and we could have ordered another dish.  The issue is that when the original dishes were so bad.....who wants to order more food from the same kitchen?

CNFS949zrVDqzuito_JAxg.text: My family ordered seafood ramen, pad Thai with udon noodles, chicken donburi and beef donburi. Nothing was appetizing, and all of it could not be considered Asian or Asian fusion. The chicken and beef donburi were bland and the only taste was soy sauce. There was not even enough soy sauce. The seafood ramen had a strange sharp flavor and a piece of soggy fried fish inside. The pad Thai was so so and was the only thing worth eating. For an appetizer, we ordered pork dumplings/gyoza. When it says pork dumplings, it is literally ONLY pork, no vegetables at all to make the filling tasty. It melted in my mouth, and not in a good way. Overall, the food did not taste good, but it looked attractive. So if you are willing to spend money on nothing but Instagram pictures, go for it, but otherwise, stay away.

GW-nrgkXDJBT2ZaH43wrDg.text: I heard from a native English fellow that Wagamama was good. So I tried it for the first time and it was very average. I decided maybe it was just my dish, I'll try it again to give my final opinion about it. So this was my 2nd time at Wagamama but first time at this location. Let's just say I am quite disappointed about this place. The curry was average and the yaki soba noodles were not good at all. The flavor was bland and I am not talking about the amount of salt they put in the dishes. Wagamama definitely does not have authentic dishes. Although, if there is a Wagamama nearby and I'm hungry, I would stop here to eat something if there is nothing else around. Wagamama is also overpriced. I have had authentic dishes and they had cheaper prices than this place.Side note: this location has an amazing view. I definitely loved it.

T-wrsQHf3EeS8AHcEhSZsg.text: I tried this twice, no more. Fusion restaurants are always a gamble, especially when it is a style from the far side of the earth. Their combinations just don't taste any good.

1sPiZnpjs6qyfuAsD0QAGw.text: Gluten free options! Very knowledgeable staff, willing to ensure everything is gluten free (no guessing, like I've see at other place). Easy to read menu for gluten free options. Affordable. Excellent for a quick lunch while seeing the sights. Also gives the option of ordering ahead and tracking your order with their app.

Nxenz-6qFi_rCh07p2tYkw.text: No, this isn't actually "Japanese."  I suppose it's the easiest category to fit it into though, considering there isn't just a "noodle" category.  It's more like a fusion - type chain, but they do fusion pretty well IMO.I'm tempting to give this place 3 stars because:  1) I was seriously freezing my ass off when we found this place, so ANY hot noodle dish was going to leave me pleasantly satisfied; and 2) the view was great for touristy people ... like myself.  ^_^However, a few things stuck out:The cafeteria style seating (don't misunderstand, there is waiter service) makes it ideal for large groups, but I was just here with a party of two and considering how EMPTY this place was for dinner on a weekday, we felt a little dwarfed by the set up.Also, I find it really odd when all ordered entrees aren't delivered to the table together and all at the same time.  I realize Wagamama probably want to serve you your dish exactly right when it's fresh and ready, but if you're like me, you aren't going to start eating it until everyone has their food anyway.  So what's the point?On to the food:The chicken kare lomen was 4 stars in my ravaged, freezing state.  OMG.  I devoured it.  However, Wagamama is a popular chain masquerading as some authentic noodle house, which it is not.  So while the dish was satisfying at the time, I cannot award it 4 stars in hindsight.  It was an average, 3 star meal.The ramen here is seriously lacking.  This is to be expected.  Their pork miso ramen is a testament to how much Wagamama's is white-washed.  Of course, this is a touristy location in a white city.  So I wasn't surprised.  But for those who might be... if you're expecting "authentic" ramen, you're in the wrong place...  Avoid ordering ramen unless you are at a ramen house, because what you will receive is equivalent to instant noodles.For vegetarians, they only had a few items on the menu particularly catered to your requirements.  To my memory, I think it was around 3 or 4 items only.  However, they were willing to work around my friend's diet as most of their noodle soups use a veggie base anyway and it was simple enough just to remove the chicken.You'd think that "chocolate ginger cheesecake" sounds amazing.  Then you get it ... and it's just .... blah.  Not impressed.  Maybe I was duped by the title of the dessert and had my expectations set too high.  Ah well.  The point is, don't allow the menu's flavourful wording to dupe you!On the bonus side, they gave us promotional cards for our next visit, good for "2 for 1 meals" at any Wagamama.  Too bad I haven't redeemed mine yet...

XqVgEmL1yZPuxXb6aIlDGw.text: This place is so freakin' amazing I want to make one my own franchise and put it in my house. Their food is so good it makes me close my eyes and enjoy each and every savory bite. When I opened my eyes there came a tear because:1. This is a chain Japanese restaurant that is totally amazing and widespread. Why don't I have this in California??2. OMG the closest Wagamama is 3,000 miles from me in Boston???!!3. The chicken curry was the best thing EVER. So good.My boyfriend ended up buying me the Wagamama cookbook online when we got home because we were so homesick for some tasty Japanese dishes. Then I wear my Wagamama shirt I bought there for reminiscing purposes. It's really good too and I recommend it to all of the travelers who now have Wagamama withdraws. This place is authentic, tasty, fairly cheap, casual and the best Japanese food in London and the US.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Curry
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Lychee Ice Cream
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Yakisoba

hWYYm5Yf2kg-gJ7tS85fDg.text: After the third (and worst) experience with take out from this location over the last two months, we are not ordering again.  None of the three times we ordered actually were prepared as specified - extra sauce, not hot, etc and each time we had one entirely inedible entree out of three.  The food was overcooked, meats were very dry and again, nothing was prepared as ordered.  On the last go, the meal specified as "for a kid" came with copious amounts of chili pepper.  She could not eat more than one bite and we ended up going to Pret for a sandwich instead.  The menu looks great, but the experience does not live up to the visual.

O9SqF6mjALiJblDXCw5Q8Q.text: The best part about this place is the gorgeous view of the Bridge. And we had a nice waiter. Oh and they're great about catering to people with food allergies. After a mediocre Wagamana experience near the British Museum (blandest and grossest-colored "curry" I have ever experienced), I gave this place a second chance. Nope, it wasn't just that particular branch. At this branch I ordered the Ginger Chicken Udon. The first bite I took assaulted my palate with this really unappealing bitter taste. It was such an unattractive dish, so carelessly prepared, with just random bits of this and that, including RAW onions, random unidentifiable string-like scraps, and DARK meat. If you're gonna serve dark meat, you should really put that on the menu, because I don't know anyone who would willingly order it. The chicken just wasn't good. They do give you a lot of food, which is good for value, but not if that food isn't great.

Jfz9h4x5Gddasio4DGGGlg.text: We had just finished a long day of site seeing, which finished at the Tower of London and found this place very closeby.  It's a chain that we also have here in the states, although I had never been.  You have a waiter, but it's mostly a quick service vibe (paper on the table that they write your order on, etc).  We started with edamame and pork gyoza (dumplings) - both very good, although the 4 of us could have done with 2 orders of dumplings.  My children (12&15) got the chicken teriyaki, I got the pad Thai with shrimp, and my husband got the chicken ramen (which was huge but lovely with nice greens).  The price was reasonable for London, and the service was great.  I had a small chip in the bottom my glass, and the entire thing was replaced right away even though I had drunk most of my beer.  I would go again.

hfScuu5NDjmX_8VA7F8NBw.text: It it's very convenient and the decor is nice. I ordered the Firecracker with prawns. The flavors were GREAT but it was incredibly spicy. When I ordered it, our nice waitress warned me that it was spicy. The menu said the same, but I assumed that she was only exaggerating. I consider myself a spice lover, but this was way out of my realm. Like I said, the flavor was great, so if not for the immense spice, it would be a five-star dish. It seems like instead of listing it as "spicy," the menu should have classified it as "very spicy." Everyone else in my six-person party enjoyed their food, so the spice in my dish is the only thing holding it back from a five-star review.

FdzlalGnPg7nGBTApDevog.text: Nice chic atmosphere but ramen was mediocre.  Overcooked noodles with watery broth.  Disappointed.  Too bad because their restaurants are everywhere.  I would keep looking.

5oVjfX9rJML88dUGA_XeTQ.text: Was very excited to come. Great decor. Excellent service and atmosphere. They were very interested in making sure the food was right. But need to spend some time with real ramen artisans to bring food up to snuff to match atmosphere and service.

eRyldb5A9mfTFNqTRnO3UQ.text: If you are looking for a ramen with no taste, then this is the place. No sodium, no oil and the meat leaves a lot to be desired. The soup base almost tastes like you boiled some plain water.

4Pa0bNIrTEAzPyr4vsNSTQ.text: Awesome place. I'd always heard good things about Wagamama, and I'm so happy that I came. They had really good noodles, though I wasn't a fan of the tofu but that's my own fault. Also, was happy to see Asahi beer here. The waitress was really helpful since it was our first time there. They do give you silverware if you ask. The long tables that are shared by several parties is fun if you have nearby groups that are friendly. Great atmosphere, and I'm glad there's one in Dublin so I don't have to wait to go again!

WIXBqG3_0MAmpgBkyTeD1A.text: Excellent sushi, cooked by a real, professional chef. You should definitely try the place if you haven't already  even if you don't like Japanese food, the restaurant can definitely surprise you. Also, it's always my first choice when I want to impress visiting friends.

Rv4vjsQt9YKnaX4ys-f7JQ.text: I wasn't a fan yesterday when I sat down for what I hoped would be a quick lunch.  I ordered the chicken katsu curry.  It was not quick and I didn't order any sides or appetizers.  The dish smelled great when they put it down, sweet and fragrant, my first bite of chicken was fantastic, but the "curry" sauce they poured over it was not what I was expecting.  It was more like a gravy than curry - maybe Indian restaurants have spoiled me for what I think curry should taste like.  But I continued eating because I paid for it and I was hungry.  It took forever to get a bill - I couldn't figure out if there was a checkout counter I was supposed to go to on my own, or if they were bringing it to me.  I ended up spending more than 40 minutes there when I intended to spend 25.  I'm not a slow eater.  Maybe I was expecting too much out of Wagamama.

Of6YZX-ePOKGKMBhfbCIkQ.text: Popped in to Wagamamas for lunch today as we didn't have a lot of time and it is quick. We were a group of 8 and even though it was very busy, we were sat down straight away. We weren't rushed when they were taking our order or made to felt like we had to leave when we had finished our meals which was good. I had the pulled pork Gyoza to start and Surendra's chicken which was a spicy curry served with rice. I've had both dishes before so I knew I would like them and I wasn't disappointed! Overall, not a bad Wagas. Service was decent, food was good and everyone left happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Steamed pulled pork Gyoza
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Little recipe on the place mat
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Surendra's chicken curry and rice

wQK9N-m1T2HMaEb_4njh-Q.text: Alright flavor, but my noodles were way too soft:/ Service was alright.I had the pork ramen, but also tried my friend's chicken ramen. Neither of us finished even half. They were both super bland. I'm a ramen fan, but this just wasn't that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom

fpHTv8AFcAoXQ_KGdJSdEQ.text: Ramen was fantastic and my friend enjoyed a mixed rice dish too. I got the one with BBQ porkbelly (bulgogi flavored I think?) and it was supposed to have a "rich" broth but my broth was more watery. I liked it because I am not too fond of rich broth, but for those who were expecting something rich, it might have been a surprise. Also it took too long to get our check and water.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom

Rwb4Z6WO91AwTpP2fIyRNA.text: We visited this restaurant after touring Tower of London so it was very convenient. The place was crowded on a Saturday afternoon. Servers take your table order and then bring the food as the individual dishes arrive. Certainly, this is not the place to go for a calm social meal. It seems to be a decent choice for a quick meal even if the space and service is somewhat chaotic. The food was good. I wouldn't seek it out again but if you need to eat when this is convenient it is a fine choice.

lVlFzO-VlK7H6Y6N8RYKDg.text: Came here for a birthday dinner and we had a great time.  Chicken gyoza were amazing, as was the lollipop prawns.   Chili steak ramen was ok, but it was overshadowed by the appetizers.  Views and atmosphere are fun.

IXLRaZhWoMCxC10zIHMdZA.text: A v handy place for lunch after visiting the Tower of London or, like me and partner, were just strolling around on a Shaun the Sheep sculpture trail. The ginger chicken udon is my go to option. I went for edamame (can't not) and pad Thai on this occasion (tip; you can choose which noodles you have! Udon is blates the best). Boyfriend had the beef chilli ramen (v hot but a bit samey after a while, but I guess that's ramen really). All the deserts are just heaven... The staff were v bright and cheery and the restaurant was clean and spacious. There were lots of lone diners too, which is a cool sight to see - I always wondered when solo dining would become big in the UK!

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Edamame and my boyfriend's giant left hand.

n-OaWY83OMW5ZJAZUBP6LA.text: Pho soup was extremely salty but bland at the same time, even adding 2 sides of kimchi (up charge for each) into the soup. I'm not sure how they accomplished this feat... but they did. Definitely not an authentic experience in the Pho department which is what i was looking for on the dreary day i stopped in on. Not terrible when in a pinch but this would definitely not be a destination for me.Two stars for the green juice which was pretty good and the half decent service.

XekxnEj09ftM8cTuO7kzqg.text: Great service, didnt have to wait long to get our dinner and the view was also pretty cool. I would go back there and also recommend to friends

4xVjm06X0fOJ7Pav5IjrAQ.text: Truly terrible food. I had a ginger omelet in my ramen which had the texture of jello. Our main dishes came out 15 minutes from each other. The sticky buns were mushy and had about a half a cup of mayo on them. No one around us seemed to enjoy or even eat their food

wsiKRQwi0GKLLkZKc0Q18w.text: I had a friend from the US rave about this place and how I had to try it when she heard I was heading to the UK. Perhaps it was because I live in california and have a large variety of Asian food available, but this was no better than a local pho place. It is similar to marachuan Ramen (ya know the cheap stove top stuff) but with even less flavor. I got the wagamama and I had to douse it in soy sauce and ask for some spicy pork sauce to give it some flavor. But then it just tasted like soy sauce. I still gave it 3 stars because the service was attentive and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Wagamama Ramen! The classic.

P9m3krQ7AdO6fvJfPW-mTQ.text: Wagamama is a chain of "Asian" style restaurants in Western Europe with about 20+ locations in and around London.So, I'm thinking to myself...  if my Hawaii based Asian wife and Hapa daughter are craving noodles and rice while we are a long way away from home...then this place might be worth its weight in gold.Well they never did have an panic attack inspite of the fact that none of the local London restaurants appeared to have an institutional size rice cooker out in plain view of the dining room.But, one day,  we just happened to be near one of these places and I suggested that we ought to try it out just to see what it was like.Two miso ramens and one chicken curry katsu later we had warm stomachs and a better idea of what Wagamama was all about. There must be an asian person involved in creating the menus and recipes for the corporation. From what I could tell there is probably about one asian person per square mile in this area of London. And that person did not work at Wagamama.We don't do fish and chips very well here on Oahu. Wagamama doesn't do ramen justice.Seriously mediocre ramen. Little bit better chicken katsu. Better yakisoba.Better to avoid the ramen unless you just have to have a noodle fix.The place itself is nice with modern decor, cafeteria style seating, free green tea, high energy staff, clean and fresh food. I like the fact that you can order from a smart phone app or computer for take out. I'm giving them 3.5 stars for trying so hard to be modern and high tech. The food is actually good but the taste is way off from what were are accustomed to. It is definitely worth one visit to see if it suits you better than it did us.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Lots of locations

JWsbiSmkQ33YdvxleS7nQg.text: Disappointed place!!! Taste not even closed to any Japanese ramen at all. Also, the crispy chicken, teriyaki chicken don, fried udon...none of these dishes are good. I don't understand why people would recommend this restaurant. Trust me. Better to eat McDonald's. By the way, i can't post this unless I gave a star...Not even worth one.

HJXb5BDbc3Y3QudfQDCcoQ.text: Walked in and the place was not filled up even though it was a little after lunch hour. I sat down with my family and ordered tea (because it was free and being from the US £2 for a drink was steep) and I wish I paid for a soda. The tea tasted like fish and salt.... I kid you not... I got my yaki soba and I wasn't expecting anything mind blowing but come on! For all the relishes and protein in this dish it tasted bland. There were hints of ginger here and there but it wasn't special and even good really. My fam ordered the chicken ramen and teriyaki chicken and they said theirs was okay. I didn't try anything else so I perhaps I just had the least popular item. The prices were good. That much I can say.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Menu

rwM2-JJttL96v1eik2maFQ.text: In an extremely touristic location we found a relatively quiet haven and great service here. he broths are great and extremely filling (huge bowls!).

tJ9msiFA-vzcPs3TM8laPA.text: If you are looking to grab lunch after the British Museum-lets face it looking at relics and mummies for hours can leave one famished- the original Wagamama is a great lunch option. They have a nice selection a Asian fusion cuisine that is tasty and reasonably priced by London standards! The restaurant is downstairs so don't worry if it feels like you are walking through a door to nowhere under the sign! We also tried the location by the Tower of London- apparently stories of treason and royal intrigue make me just as hungry as the mummies- this one is in a big modern building above the ticket office with big windows an nice view. Both have cafeteria seating which makes it really good for large groups. I was first introduced in '06 by my professors who take their study abroad kids here every trip, and they must be doing something right because the chain has spread all over the city!!

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Entrance to Wagamama by the British Museum

tlSkKvTPunEIxXqSA15oXA.text: A large restaurant, this Wagamama offers quick service and space to accommodate the tourist crowds from the Tower of London. I got the ramen (don't remember exactly which, but remember it having the rich broth). The broth in this version was a little too salty for my tastes, but overall it hit the spot on a cold day. They offer free green tea and the rest of their dishes are a pretty decent value. Great place to stop if you want to grab a quick bite.

nAbKhOFScS7HtwYKe-elAw.text: Great and plentiful Asian fusion cuisine located right off the Victoria Embankment Pier beside the Tower of London.  Two teenage boys left very full after a late lunch.  Lunch for 3 ran about 52 pounds so a bit on the pricey side, but filling.  Staff were helpful.

JNbfQKl2c_X4bZw4gOcnjw.text: They only deserve stars at all for the drink selection. The fresh juice was very good. The food however was mushy and rather tasteless. Honestly pretty terrible. It was extremely overpriced for something I could have made better at home.

gAgtChXGhGC0s8JeB9qAWA.text: Yum!I went to Europe on holiday and my companion and I only had one day in London. I'd been to London many times before but wanted to cram in all the sites into our day. We got to Tower of London and Tower Bridge just around lunch time so we decided to get something with hot soup since the weather was quite chilly.I had the miso ramen while my companion had the yakisoba noodles. Both were nothing crazy outstanding, but they were delicious and definitely hit the spot. We also shared an appetizer of chicken wings seasoned in an "Asian" way.Service is seriously quick and the staff is really nice. Seating is arranged in long tables where you may end up sitting next to some strangers, but luckily we were there at a non-busy hour so we had lots of space to ourselves.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. miso ramen (far) and chicken wings (middle) and yakisoba (close)

ruID-t-Xsm69udi2ldeYYw.text: If you're visiting the Tower of London and need a quick lunch, this place is perfect, especially if it is cold or rainy. I got the chilli ramen with beefsteak- delicious, fresh, very filling, warm, and just the right amount of spicy. The portion is huge too. The servers are very friendly and quick and the view of the tower and bridge is great. The seating is kind of like a cafeteria but very clean and modern, and the staff was very nice and accommodating when we requested to sit on the far side for a bit more quiet. Loved it for our quick stay in London in between sightseeing!

6lQ2_G3ir2pZWeKeE57SHw.text: Had the Ramen. It was really good. seasones to perfection. The broth was full bodied and the noodles were the best ive had in a long time

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Savory and DELICUOUS. Chicken Raman

nY3KadI7BSZTKn5uCYm31w.text: Good ramen and soup here. Didn't skimp on the veggies in my itame and the broth was pretty flavorful and a little spicy. The chicken ramen had good broth but was otherwise fairly unremarkable. All the meals I saw other customers eating looked delicious and it was difficult to decide what to get. I would love to return and try more of their offerings!

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Tofu itame.
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Chicken ramen.

MDeAaD3dST6q63NNpm-kPg.text: Went here for ramen and honestly should have expected that it wouldn't be authentic. That being said, the locale has a great view of Tower Bridge and Tower of London and was evidently very trendy.My entire party ordered the Wagamama ramen and it was good if you don't think of it as a ramen. All the toppings were tasty but the broth was nothing spectacular and the noodle consistency was weird to me but again I think I was expecting ramen noodles. Might want to return and try something else maybe.

HOLtH9E5VJbrVZJKXaDqqA.text: I had Wagamama the first night I came to London and I didn't even know it was a chain. It looked really new and hip inside so I decided to give it a try. Honestly, it wasn't that bad I actually thought it was different from the food that I've tried in the US mostly because of the Japanese/Korean fusion and their use of duck.They have a bar that serves sake and beer.. I don't remember if it had other things. I tried their duck bibimbap which was actually pretty tasty, their pork buns which was pretty mediocre... and their duck wings which I liked, but had too many tiny shards of bones. The price point is probably a little on the pricier side after converting pounds to dollars, but all in all I feel like I had a decent experience!

oiqQzGi9Q31Q4naAXs0oxA.text: This is a pretty good place for Asian fast food. I got the fried noodles with beef. Surprisingly there was a nice amount of meat and it was cooked medium, which is great since most fast food places basically over cook your meat. The place was spacious and clean so I have no complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom

q-HK3ZmgVd0F856_R1DhNQ.text: This is suchhhh a cute place! Great open area, open kitchen. Awesome menu choices, reasonable prices and the food was really good and huge portions. The service was also on point, so glad we stumbled upon this spot. Highly recommend!

Zqh15hwS3vXHPO7uJT5Ycw.text: Wagamama, although you are a chain restaurant I do see uniqueness in your menu. There are a lot of fun sounding items on the menu that makes my mouth water. Two items that caught my attention that particular night was the Lollipop Prawns and the Grilled Duck Donburi. The Lollipop Prawns were so good I actually hesitated in sharing with my friends. The Grilled Duck Donburi was not a disappointment either. It came with shredded duck meat, mixed vegetables, topped with a sunny side up egg and a side of kimchi. Even though it's a donburi it was more like a bibimbap in my opinion. My friend ordered the ramen and was disappointed because the soup was not warm enough.   The prices are reasonable considering the location. They're right next to Tower Bridge and the Tower of London. If you get seated next to the window you can get a beautiful view of both of those landmarks. The downfall of this particular Wagamama location is their service. The host was great but the waiters are very inattentive. It must've took around 15 minutes before the waiter came over to take our orders. Even after our orders it took him a long time to get our beverages. How long does it take to prepare green tea? The waiter also never cared to check up on us to ask if we were satisfied with our meals. Even when it was time for the bill it took awhile before we could wave him over to our table. Wagamama I definitely like your food but the lack of customer service usually leaves a "bad taste" in your customer's mouth.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Shrimp Lollipop
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Duck Donburi

NlW8XbHdXv5pUcsYdiQkUw.text: great Wagamama Ramen!!! We were cold tired and hungry and this place came up on yelp! Nice price point!

ilrX_wUo2qPQF3Hp2rmNhA.text: I have seen Wagamama's before, though I can't place my finger on exactly where (HK? NYC? Maybe both.)We were in London for a very short stay and was dying to find good food, anywhere. After a day at The Tower of London, we came across Wagamama. My cousin had mentioned that the food at this chain was good and we should check this place out, so off we went. The place was very crowded and loud. Servers were running about hectically. The service was lacking and was more at the caliber of uncaring fast food workers. However, the food here was good though it was more fusion than authentic. We all ordered  different variations of ramen noodles.  We all chose the chicken broth and I like that the broth here isn't overly salty nor too rich/thick. It was light but flavorful. One bizarre incident here was that our server brought over a portable credit card device to insert my credit card. After doing so, the screen asked if I wanted to leave a tip and if so how much. our server was hovering over me while holding the device for me to complete the transaction! Tacky but I felt compelled to leave a tip.

Qnz7mau6QqwLMXkWeh3jNg.text: 7/29/17We were in the London Tower area around lunch on our last day, and were looking for a bite to eat. We walked around under the bridge for a bit to check out all of the food vendors, but didn't see anything we liked. A restroom stop was needed as well, so we popped into Wagamama.Interesting fusion of Indian and Asian. I was craving some curry, so I chose the curry dish. It was very non-traditional, as one would expect at a fusion type restaurant. The food tasted fresh and was well prepared with a very nice serving size. The curry was like a masala mixed with pad thai over rice. They did have pad thai here but I wanted to try something different. I was satisfied with the food. I keep thinking the service is going to get better over here, but it never does. I guess people are used to being ignored once they order their food. Like everywhere else in England, service sucks.

FR5O5RpUQ2usJcN4YGFTOQ.text: The location is very convenient and serviceIs quick. However the food is not great. We ordered a curry and pad Thai dish. I had to add soy sauce to my pad Thai (which I never imagined I would do) just to have some semblance of flavor. The curry was equally dull and disappointing. The prices are too high considering the quality of dishes. Also, I am always disappointed when I have to pay for still water. Not impressed.

WZ4LDyRKVnFQsX4FIiefNQ.text: Wok green and positive juice were both excellent but the yabi soba left much to be desired. Decent experience overall.

39wdKfZ1wCnUlvX-DInbmQ.text: Went for supper on Sunday around 7:20 PM. The place was perhaps 60% full and with a nice atmosphere. We (3 guys) were seated promptly, but despite the fact that it was not at capacity it took a few minutes for our waiter to make first contact and take orders. The waiter and sincere and attentive and provided good service.Got appetizers - edamame with salt and some kimchee - which came promptly; before the drinks (beer, green tea and water - nothing complicated).Maybe 5 minutes later the entrees started to arrive and our waiter did warn that they will come at different times - I guess as they are prepared. We all had ramen soup - I had the Wagamama Ramen and my colleagues had the Chili Sirloin Steak Ramen. All were delicious although I found mine less than piping hot, which is how I like it,Afterwards I had a decaf coffee and one of my colleagues had a double espresso - all good.All in all a great meal after a long day of travel! Definitely recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Wagamama Ramen

Ur8UUdztyMg8BNzQ-7lXjg.text: The food is bland as heck. I really tried to like the food because it is chain of somewhat. I really didn't like it at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom

KFPgu5gyI4S0Ge8V6rfU1Q.text: Wagamama, take some time to learn these famous words from the amazing Amy Winehouse (RIP) "you know, that I'm no good." Dear Wagamama,You need to change up your staff (but it's not your only problem) . The only dude who smiled, was polite, and gave two craps about us was not even our real waiter. He was the guy who worked there but realized we were being ignored so came to offer help. His name, you ask? I don't know. But he told us he is expecting his first baby boy. He was genuine, kind, helpful, and your best representation. Our waitress was rude. Didn't care to bring me a straw for my water when I asked for it. Ignored my request for individual small plates so that the four of us could share appetizers, and never offered to refill our water NOT EVEN ONCE. I realize now (according to my brother in law) that no one really tips in the UK because people supposedly get paid better than waiters/waitresses in the USA but there is some common decent customer service. This is ridiculous. My pad Thai came out last, at least ten min after everyone else. Then the man who brought out the food was argumentative and said that they bring the food out when it's done one at a time and failed to acknowledge that maybe my plate had just been sitting there waiting to be brought to me but that no one noticed from their staff. The duck gyozawas OK. The lollipop shrimp was great. My pad Thai was awful. I had to ask for four extra limes to drown the awful flavor. It had a lot of veggies but really did not taste like any pad Thai I've ever had. One more time: Wagamama, take some time to learn these famous words from the amazing Amy Winehouse (RIP) "you know, that I'm no good."

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Curry
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. The repair was awesome. 4 stars.

QzLYY3NuweiJrA47AfFJ1Q.text: Visiting Tower of London and this was nearby for something hot on a cold, cloudy grey day.  They made effort to seat our large party of 9, so we didn't mind squeezing into table typically suited for 8.Service was friendly and relatively fast.  It's Asian fusion.. tried duck ramen which had plenty of shredded duck meat.  Other chicken ramen was also good.Wouldn't go out of way to visit this location specifically for food.  Would go only if you are in area. It's a biggish chain.  Hadn't tried other locations but thought this location was solid enough.  Good hearty Asian fusion noodle bar.

f1unimycrMfP_6cS2tqNNg.text: We were famished after a day at the Tower of London so this fit the bill easily. It's Asian Fusion that's fairly quick, decently priced, & of decently good taste. We've had better but in all the food was decently seasoned with fair sized portions. Service was okay. Not great but not terrible. We probably would eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. This was the Pad Thai hubby had with prawns. He's another big eater but felt it was a decent portion
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. The Yaki Udon with Chicken. I think it was right sized but of course my hungry teen boy was still hungry
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. The Wagamama ramen was filling & decently seasoned

JlbPsAoTQK5Q0oE8DVjw-A.text: Wagamama means to be "selfish/spoiled" in Japanese (usually referring to as a child). There's nothing to be spoiled about eating here, but I guess the name still fits because you'll find out the food is horrible and the restaurant can call you by its name. LOLIt was across from Tower of London, so I just settled here. I was not expecting much going in, but I just wanted to see the quality. Wagamama seems to be like the McDonald's of "Japanese" ramen in London... it's all over the place. I believe they're more Thai taste than Japanese. They are Chinese owned. I tried the Wagamama ramen, which contains all sorts of stuff: grilled chicken, barbecued pork, egg, onions, prawns, bamboo shoots, chikuwa, mussels, ginger, in chicken noodle soup... sounded good, but everything just tasted like right-out-of-package quality... ugh... definitely nowhere near authentic Japanese at all... "You're being Wagamama!!" "No, I'm not!!" Okay I'm talking to myself. The noodles were the worst as it was so dry. Even instant noodles from Japan taste better. No flavor at all. The karaage was the worst ever! How can they even call it that?? Tiny hard mess. I think the calamari was the only reasonable one out of the stuff ordered. So if you want to try a "McDonald's Japanese ramen" in London, check out this place, complain about the food, and they can call you "Wagamama".

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Wagamama Ramen... eh.
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Very dry noodles. More like soba than ramen.
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom

5Vt-pAX13XtDn9n84dlO_g.text: Went at a really busy time (Sunday lunch) but managed to get a table really quickly. We got served and I was expecting the food to take a while given how busy it was. However our food came very quickly and was delicious! Our server was very friendly and asked if everything was okay during our meal. The vegan options are generous but I do wish there was more variety. I'm sure if I had asked to veganise other dishes that would have been fine though. The meals were generous as Wagamama meals generally are. I would definitely go to this one again. The staff member at the front was very friendly and smiled at us and said goodbye as we were leaving.

photos.caption: Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. Vegan pad Thai...yum!
Photo of Wagamama - London, United Kingdom. My friend's non vegan meal.

NRpXJY-OSNEBLVQAjCf6bw.text: I travel to London a fair amount for work, and Wagamama is my go to spot. It's great for take out, or to eat in. If you are traveling alone, the setup does not make you feel awkward at all about dining as a party of one.The food is reliable, consistent. The prices are fair, the service is quick and friendly, and the location is extremely convenient to both the insurance district and Tower of London.
